camshaft &
cylinder head gasket (just to not totally give you the shaft)

Case Western Reserve,
Austin Peay
Cleaning up cow manure for a king, collecting golden fruit, swiping a girdle... sounds like scenes in "Animal House", but no

gavials,
skinks

Well-marbled beef,
the 0 degree line of longitude,
the number 5
An early citation for this term for jewelry goes back to a song featuring Lil Wayne
There is no need to have a dental item for doing this, a word meaning showing off; Dr. Dre rhymed it with Slauson
Used as an interjection in trap music, this vowelless word conveys the sound of tires screeching
On "Otis", Jay-Z claimed to have "invented" this 4-letter term defined as bold assurance or great self-confidence
Thug Passion, a cocktail that's one part Aliz√© & one part Cristal, is referenced on this rapper's 1996 album "All Eyez On Me"
In a book from 1900, this character says, "I don't know anything.  You see, I am stuffed, so I have no brains at all"
This character is "a bear of very little brain, and long words bother" him
In a song by Jimi Hendrix, this title phrase is followed by "all in my brain"
"Miss Warren has brains: you can't deny that", says his play "Mrs. Warren's Profession"; the response: "Brains are not everything"
In "A Tale of a Tub", this 18th century satirist called books "the children of the brain"
Of 11, 22 or 33, the height in feet of the board in Olympic platform diving
2 types of elevating work platforms are a scissor lift & this type of crane with a fruit in its name
To help him do this job, Leopold Stokowski designed his own podium: round, with steps & covered in non-slip rubber
In carmaking a platform is the basic chassis & architecture; the Nissan 370Z & this luxe brand's QX70 used the same one
Upvote or downvote posts on this social media platform that has communities like AMA (Ask Me Anything) & WallStreetBets
The "original" flavor of this century-old woven cracker brand has 3 ingredients: whole grain wheat, canola oil & sea salt
This brand's ubiquitous singles now come in Swiss & pepper jack
This alliterative Japanese food container suggests your fare is going to be delivered within 4 sides
These little French teacakes whose name means "little oven" are often square
This revered San Francisco chocolatier sells squares of the sweet with peppermint bark or raspberry filling
Cook County
Laramie County
Maricopa County
Fairfax County
Multnomah County
In "Why Him?" this "Breaking Bad" star does not understand the appeal of James Franco (but his daughter does)
Ashton Kutcher & Seann William Scott search for a jalopy while aliens look for the continuum transfunctioner in this film
In this 1962 film former child star Bette Davis lives in a crumbling Hollywood mansion with her invalid sister
Ice Cube tries to get out of the friend zone with Nia Long by offering to drive her kids to Vancouver in this 2005 film
The title of this Coen Bros. film comes from a movie Joel McCrea wanted to make in Preston Sturges' "Sullivan's Travels"
This irregular past tense verb is what I did to start our game of whist
This irregular past tense verb can mean completely tired out & exhausted
A brother"ood" of irregular past tenses is stood, understood & this, meaning "resisted"
This word meaning "said not to do that thing" rhymes with "had" to traditionalists but with "maid" to many others
You don't say "I brod the fish before frying it", nor "I throd the needle", so why this word meaning "stepped"?
Peter Matthiessen climbed mountains in Nepal to see the snow type of this creature, the title of his National Book Award winner
After accepting a drink of liquor in a Washington Irving tale, Rip Van Winkle falls asleep for 20 years in these mountains
In the novel "Lost Horizon", the Kunlun Range is thought to be home to this lamasery whose name has become a synonym for utopia
"Der Zauberberg" in German, this Thomas Mann novel tells the story of a man who stays in a TB clinic for 7 years
A Miskatonic Univ. team uncovers horrific artifacts in Antarctica in this author's "At the Mountains of Madness"
"Can't you see me standing here, I've got my back against the record machine"; now leap in & name this hit, VH's only No. 1
Turns out his tongue had an eye for talent! This KISS bassist was an early Van Halen supporter, producing a demo for the band in 1976
Attributed to this original Van Halen frontman: "I used to jog but the ice cubes kept falling out of my glass"
The purpose of Van Halen's rider saying no to the brown color of this candy was to ensure their complicated contract got read
A "volcanic" rock event, the solo called this on VH's 1st album introduced Eddie's 2-handed guitar tapping to a stunned world
In Houston the "MOB" is the Marching Owl Band of this university
The Pritzker School of Law is part of this "directional" Big Ten school
The land donated to start this ACC sports powerhouse was home to the estate of John C. Calhoun
Author Ralph Ellison was a music student at this Alabama institute
The name of this Omaha university honors a man who built the transcontinental telegraph
It sounds like you are clearing your throat to get my attention
This interjection is the first thing Lil Jon says on Usher's hit of the same title
This hyphenated term is paired with SpaghettiOs in an ad
This mild oath was a favorite of Napoleon Dynamite
The fictional dimwitted English gentleman Bertie Wooster uses this interjection, an alteration of "Oh God!"

rounds.text: The first British sitcom to win a Best Comedy Golden Globe, it was remade in a U.S. version that had almost 15 times as many episodes
